blocks.name: rrx2pxel
blocks.content: The x-coordinate of a point in a real Euclidean space of dimension 2 is a real number. (Contributed by AV, 2-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: rrx2pyel
blocks.content: The y-coordinate of a point in a real Euclidean space of dimension 2 is a real number. (Contributed by AV, 2-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: prelrrx2
blocks.content: An unordered pair of ordered pairs with first components 1 and 2 and real numbers as second components is a point in a real Euclidean space of dimension 2. (Contributed by AV, 4-Feb-2023.)

  3jca(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wa(wcel(nat1, universe), wcel(nat2, universe)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wne(nat1, nat2))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wa(wcel(nat1, universe), wcel(nat2, universe)))
  pm3.2i(wcel(nat1, universe), wcel(nat2, universe))
  1ex()
  2ex()
  id(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wne(nat1, nat2))
  1ne2()
  fprg(nat1, universe, nat2, universe, c0, cr, c1, cr)

blocks.name: rrx2pnecoorneor
blocks.content: If two different points ` X ` and ` Y ` in a real Euclidean space of dimension 2 are different, then they are different at least at one coordinate. (Contributed by AV, 26-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm rrx2pnecoorneor(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| wceq(c3, cpr(nat1, nat2))
  -| wceq(c1, co(cr, cmap, c3))
} = {
  sylibr(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1), wne(c0, c2)), wo(wne(cfv(c0, nat1), cfv(c2, nat1)), wne(cfv(c0, nat2), cfv(c2, nat2))), wn(wa(wceq(cfv(c0, nat1), cfv(c2, nat1)), wceq(cfv(c0, nat2), cfv(c2, nat2)))))

  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wa(wceq(cfv(c0, nat1), cfv(c2, nat1)), wceq(cfv(c0, nat2), cfv(c2, nat2)))), wceq(c0, c2), wral(hs0, c3, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs0)))))
  sylibr(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wa(wceq(cfv(c0, nat1), cfv(c2, nat1)), wceq(cfv(c0, nat2), cfv(c2, nat2)))), wral(hs0, c3, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs0)))), wa(wceq(cfv(c0, nat1), cfv(c2, nat1)), wceq(cfv(c0, nat2), cfv(c2, nat2))))

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 ‚â† c2)‚Üí((c0 ` 1)‚â†(c2 ` 1)‚à®(c0 ` 2)‚â†(c2 ` 2)))
  ‚ä£ c3 = { 1, 2 }
  ‚ä£ c1 =(‚Ñù[‚Ü¶]c3)
} = {
  sylibr((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 ‚â† c2), ((c0 ` 1)‚â†(c2 ` 1)‚à®(c0 ` 2)‚â†(c2 ` 2)), ¬¨((c0 ` 1)=(c2 ` 1)‚àß(c0 ` 2)=(c2 ` 2)))
  3impia(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c1, c0 ‚â† c2, ¬¨((c0 ` 1)=(c2 ` 1)‚àß(c0 ` 2)=(c2 ` 2)))
  necon3ad(c0, c2, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1), ((c0 ` 1)=(c2 ` 1)‚àß(c0 ` 2)=(c2 ` 2)))

  sylibr(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚àß((c0 ` 1)=(c2 ` 1)‚àß(c0 ` 2)=(c2 ` 2))), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c3,(c0 ` hs0)=(c2 ` hs0)), ((c0 ` 1)=(c2 ` 1)‚àß(c0 ` 2)=(c2 ` 2)))
  simpr((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1), ((c0 ` 1)=(c2 ` 1)‚àß(c0 ` 2)=(c2 ` 2)))

  raleqi(hs0, c3, { 1, 2 }, (c0 ` hs0)=(c2 ` hs0))
  ralpr(hs0, nat1, nat2, (c0 ` hs0)=(c2 ` hs0), (c0 ` 1)=(c2 ` 1), (c0 ` 2)=(c2 ` 2))

blocks.name: rrx2xpreen
blocks.content: The set of points in the two dimensional Euclidean plane and the set of ordered pairs of real numbers (the cartesian product of the real numbers) are equinumerous. (Contributed by AV, 12-Mar-2023.)

  reex()
  f1oeq1(cv(hs0), cmpo(hs1, hs2, cr, cr, cpr(cop(nat1, cv(hs1)), cop(nat2, cv(hs2)))), cxp(cr, cr), c0)

  eqid(cmpo(hs1, hs2, cr, cr, cpr(cop(nat1, cv(hs1)), cop(nat2, cv(hs2)))))
  bren(hs0, cxp(cr, cr), c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cmpo(hs1, hs2, cr, cr, cpr(cop(nat1, cv(hs1)), cop(nat2, cv(hs2)))))
  diff.hs0.w(wf1o(cmpo(hs1, hs2, cr, cr, cpr(cop(nat1, cv(hs1)), cop(nat2, cv(hs2)))), cxp(cr, cr), c0))
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)

blocks.name: rrx2plord
blocks.content: The lexicographical ordering for points in the two dimensional Euclidean plane: a point is less than another point iff its first coordinate is less than the first coordinate of the other point, or the first coordinates of both points are equal and the second coordinate of the first point is less than the second coordinate of the other point: (a,b) <_ (x,y) :<-> ( a<x \/ ( a=x /\ b<_y) ). (Contributed by AV, 12-Mar-2023.)

blocks.name: rrx2plord1
blocks.content: The lexicographical ordering for points in the two dimensional Euclidean plane: a point is less than another point if its first coordinate is less than the first coordinate of the other point. (Contributed by AV, 12-Mar-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm rrx2plord1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {

blocks.name: rrx2plordso
blocks.content: The lexicographical ordering for points in the two dimensional Euclidean plane is a strict complete ordering. (Contributed by AV, 12-Mar-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm rrx2plordso(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wor(c0, c1)
  -| wceq(c0, copab(s0, s1, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wo(wbr(cfv(cv(s0), nat1), clt, cfv(cv(s1), nat1)), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s0), nat1), cfv(cv(s1), nat1)), wbr(cfv(cv(s0), nat2), clt, cfv(cv(s1), nat2)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, co(cr, cmap, cpr(nat1, nat2)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
